greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest number less than n occurring in Collatz trajectory starting with n.
comment: In triangle A070165: a(n)-th row is a suffix of n-th row;
a(n) = A070165(n,k) for some k with 1 <= k < A006577(n);
a(n) <> A070165(m,k) for all k with 1 <= k < A006577(n), a(n) < m < n.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
Index entries for sequences related to 3x+1 (or Collatz) problem
program: a225840 n = maximum $ filter (< n) $ a070165_row n
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 16 2013
